speaker: Title Card
text: The tip of the Space Needle glows. _ACT ONE  FADE IN:  Scene One -- Radio Studio Frasier is nearing the end of his show. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think we've got time for one last caller.  Roz, who have we got? _He looks over and sees Roz on the phone, turned away from him and writing on a pad._

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm...  mmm-hmm... _Peeved, Frasier tosses a pencil against the glass to get her attention. She notices him, but waves him off._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose I'll be fielding this last one myself.  Let's try line two. [_pushes button_] Go ahead, caller, your name and problem, please.

speaker: Ernie
text: [_v.o._] Yes sir, my name's Ernie, and I'm real angry at my dog.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Ernie.  Uh, very often when people have feelings towards their pets it often reflect feelings they have about themselves and their place in society.  So tell me, why are you angry at your dog?

speaker: Ernie
text: [_v.o._] Well, he keeps telling me to take off my foil helmet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you hold on, Ernie?  Um, someone will come on the line with the number of an expert in this sort of situation.  Let's try, uh, line four. [_presses button_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_v.o._] Oh yes, of course I'm interested!  I'll fax my resume right over!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the news is up next, followed by the market update with Julia Wilcox.  That's it for me today.  This is Dr.  Frasier Crane saying, good day and good mental health. _He goes off the air and glares at Roz, who mouths, "I'm sorry."  Kenny enters with some copies, which he lays on Frasier's console._

speaker: Kenny
text: Another great show, doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you even listen?

speaker: Kenny
text: You don't have to eat every Big Mac to know it's a delicious hamburger sandwich.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, what's going on?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, but they want to interview me for the program director job at KPXY.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... that's great, but I didn't even know you were looking.

speaker: Roz
text: I wasn't!  They just called me, out of the blue!   I-I'm actually shocked, because I have very limited experience in management. But, well, Kenny's in management, how hard can it be?

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, it's not that easy.  I know it looks like a monkey can do my job, but it can't.  True story.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, gosh, Roz, I, I must say I've got some mixed feelings about this.  I mean, I couldn't be happier that you're finally getting the recognition you deserve, but I'm gonna miss you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, let's wait �til there's a real offer before we break out the Kleenex and champagne.

speaker: Julia
text: Well, Roz, Kenny told me about your job interview.  Good luck.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I get it.  It'll be good luck because if I get the job, I'll be gone.

speaker: Julia
text: No, it sounds like a good position for you.

speaker: Roz
text: Right, cause I get into a lot of sexual positions with a lot of guys.

speaker: Julia
text: I'm saying congratulations.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.  Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sotto voce to Frasier_] What's her problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're being uncharacteristically decent today.  You all right?

speaker: Julia
text: I'm fine. [_then_] All right, I might as well tell you before he does.  Avery and I broke up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Gosh, uh, what happened?

speaker: Julia
text: I got tired of listening to him promise he'd leave his wife.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry.  I realize you must be going through...

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, I don't need your sympathy.  I'm not one of your pathetic code three whackadoos.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was just trying to help.  No need to insult my callers.

speaker: Roz
text: Foil Helmet Guy says his dog needs to speak to you. _Unable to say anything to Julia, Frasier just motions vaguely towards Roz's booth before exiting.  FADE OUT.  FADE IN:  Scene Two -- Cafe Nervosa The cafe is packed -- the line to the counter reaches back to the door, and every table is occupied. Frasier enters. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excuse me... _He threads his way over to the table in the rear, where Daphne is seated alone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I've never seen this place so crowded.  What's the occasion?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's Mum's day off.  Apparently there was a mass e-mail.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, is Niles going to be joining us?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he's taking your father to the shooting range.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes, of course, I'd forgotten.  He asked me to take him, but then I suggested that when it comes to guns, perhaps he would prefer someone of Niles's...  caliber. [_chuckles_] I'm in rare form today.

speaker: Daphne
text: You should see this place when they know you're not coming. _As a couple leaves one of the tables in the middle, Julia comes in, talking on her cell phone._

speaker: Julia
text: No, Avery...  two-thirds of the work on that program is mine! Well, I don't have to prove it, it's a fact!  Oh -- oh, yeah? _Another couple from the line tries to claim the table, but Julia drops her satchel on it._

speaker: Julia
text: Well, I should have expected as much from a man who wears leopard print bikini briefs! [_holds up phone, to the whole caf e_] Avery McManus wears shiny, acetate, man-panties!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Daphne_] Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is everything okay?

speaker: Julia
text: No.  Now that I've dumped your bastard accountant, he's trying to cut me out of our software program.

speaker: Frasier
text: Software program?

speaker: Julia
text: We -- mostly me -- developed a proprietary method for analyzing price/volume momentum -- I call it vector scaling -- that can quantify the likelihood of longer-term trends.  Do you realize what that means?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_at a loss_] It's good.

speaker: Julia
text: That program is my baby, I have been working on it for months. I think your bastard accountant has been using me all along. Thanks for setting us up!

speaker: Frasier
text: I did no such thing!

speaker: Julia
text: You know what I ought to do?  I ought to go down to his office, demand my files, and then trash the place!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a second, just a second, just sit down.  Sit down, please. [_she does_] Take a moment to calm down before you make any rash decisions.

speaker: Julia
text: In a few hours, I'm leaving town for a week.  There's no way I'm leaving your bastard accountant in control of those files.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, well, if you insist, then perhaps I should go with you.  Maybe I can help facilitate things.

speaker: Julia
text: Why?  What's in it for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing!  Surely you can conceive of the possibility that someone might want to just do something nice for you?

speaker: Julia
text: You and Avery are in this together, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course not!  You're not being rational, you know.  Perhaps Avery is just holding your program hostage because he feels hurt.  Perhaps this is his clumsy way of trying to initiate a dialogue.

speaker: Julia
text: You really do try to see the best in everyone, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.

speaker: Julia
text: So, what do you see when you look at me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...  I see a woman who's been hurt, not once but many times. A woman who finds it so difficult to trust someone, she won't allow herself to be vulnerable.  A woman... [_Julia gets up and walks out_] whose eyes are going to get stuck if she keeps rolling them like that! _He gets up and follows her.  FADE OUT._ **THE BANG GANG** _FADE IN:  Scene Three -- Shooting Range Martin is standing in a booth, firing an automatic.  Niles is standing behind him, looking extremely uncomfortable.  Both are wearing ear protectors and range glasses. _

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, look at that grouping!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, uh, Dad, you about ready to go?

speaker: Martin
text: I guess I've still got the touch.  Hey, Niles, you ought to give it a try.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Dad, you know how I feel about handguns.  They breed violence.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, this is just simple target shooting, that's all.

speaker: Martin
text: Ha-ha, yeah!  Here's one dirtbag isn't going to be selling crack at any schoolyards anytime soon.

speaker: Red
text: You should listen to the man.  Shooting's a great sport. [_shaking hands_] Red Brewer.  And these clowns here are Mitch and Wayne.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm Niles Crane, and this is my father, Martin Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking hands_] Oh, hi, how you doing, guys?

speaker: Red
text: Listen Niles, let me show you how to do this.  I think you'll enjoy it.  It's pretty simple.

speaker: Red
text: You just take a solid stance, hold the grip firmly, steady your gun hand with your other, fingers to fingers, thumbs to thumb, focus on the front sight, and squeeze the trigger.

speaker: Red
text: Okay, you try.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know, no offense, but I, uh, I just, I'm not real comfortable with guns.

speaker: Red
text: You know, Mitch used to be that way, too.

speaker: Mitch
text: Yeah, the only weapon I'd go near was a bow and arrow.

speaker: Niles
text: [_interested_] I, uh, I got an archery badge at day camp.

speaker: Red
text: This is like archery, but safer.  The weapon's more stable, and you're in a controlled environment.

speaker: Martin
text: Go on, give it a try, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I, uh, just -- I'll do one little one.

speaker: Red
text: Just remember: stance, grip, aim, relax, shoot.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay. [_mimics Red_] Stance, grip, aim, relax... [_tilts his head to the left_] shoot. _He pulls the trigger.  The recoil knocks him back about a foot, but Martin and the guys look pleased._

speaker: Niles
text: Did I do it?

speaker: Red
text: You not only did it, you hit the target. [_points_] See?  Sixth ring out.  Look at the kid, he hit the target his first time.

speaker: Mitch
text: Not bad, kid.

speaker: Wayne
text: Way to go, kid.

speaker: Martin
text: That's my kid!

speaker: Niles
text: That was a unique experience.  I'm sure I'll dine out on that story for months.

speaker: Red
text: Don't quit now, go again.  But remember, this time, squeeze the trigger, don't pull.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.

speaker: Niles
text: Squeeze...

speaker: Red
text: Wow, you're pretty good at this!  The kid's a natural, am I right?

speaker: Niles
text: Can I go again?

speaker: Red
text: Yeah. _Niles, more confident, fires one shot after the other.  He experiments, tilting his head to the right and sighting with his other eye, as we:  FADE OUT.  FADE IN:  Scene Four -- Avery's Office Julia is pacing outside Avery's office door, when Frasier comes in. _

speaker: Julia
text: What took you so long?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was looking for street parking.  Do you have any idea how much this garage charges?

speaker: Julia
text: Avery's not here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great, it cost me three-fifty to find that out.

speaker: Julia
text: No, it's good.  It'll make it easier for me to get my program back.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Julia
text: I know his keypad code. [_starts to enter it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Wh-wh-what?  That is breaking and entering!

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, if you're so scared, why don't you just leave?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm-I'm not scared!  I... _The door opens, and Julia enters the office.  Frasier follows her in.  RESET TO: Office  Julia starts to rifle through Avery's desk._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll have you know I've had my fair share of escapades.  Back in med school I once dressed a cadaver in cap and gown and...

speaker: Julia
text: [_finds a disk_] Oh, here's my program!  Okay, good. [_logs on the computer_] Now, just in case he backed it up, I am going to delete everything from his hard drive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia, I-I-I beg you to rethink this.  I realize you're angry at Avery-

speaker: Julia
text: I'm not feeling anger.  Just the peace that comes with knowing that Avery will be royally screwed -- by me.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's somebody at the door! _Julia points him to the closet.  They rush in as someone outside is heard entering the code.  RESET TO: Closet  They go inside and close the door.  Julia cracks the door and peeks outside, then closes the door softly.  They both whisper:_

speaker: Julia
text: It's the cleaning woman.  I thought so, I've hidden from her before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia, there's still time to end this.

speaker: Julia
text: Shh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, you know that what you're doing is wrong.  You should just get out now before more harm is done.

speaker: Julia
text: Will you shut up?  It's pointless to hide in a closet if the people outside can hear you!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're going to get caught.

speaker: Julia
text: Because you won't shut up!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's never too late to do the right thing.  No matter how low someone else sinks, joining them there does not make things better. _Julia does not shush him.  Suddenly she wraps her arms around his neck, and kisses him, closing her eyes.  He is caught off guard, but reflexively returns the kiss and puts his arms around her...  Outside, the door closes.  She breaks away and exits back into the office. Frasier stands there, totally bewildered.  He feels his lips for a moment as if to check to see if it really happened.  Then he follows her into the office.  RESET TO: Office The cleaning lady is gone, and Julia is back typing at the computer._

speaker: Frasier
text: What was that?

speaker: Julia
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You kissed me.

speaker: Julia
text: I was trying to shut you up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.  I've been kissed to shut me up before.  This was not that.

speaker: Julia
text: Got it.  All files deleted. [_pause_] You know, that didn't make me feel as good as I thought.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because you know you did the wrong thing. _Julia shoves the contents of the desktop onto the floor, breaking the computer and scattering files._

speaker: Julia
text: [_happy_] Ah, that's better. _She runs out, followed by Frasier.  End of Act One  ACT TWO  FADE IN:  Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa The cafe is still packed.  Frasier is seated at a table when Roz comes in. _

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it doesn't look like I'll be leaving KACL anytime soon. [_crosses to the counter_] Coffee to go, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... dear lord, what-what happened, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_sits with him_] Turns out the person who's interviewing me is a guy I've slept with.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are the odds?

speaker: Roz
text: [_gives him a look, then_] It was ten years ago, at a convention in Cancun.  We were all hammered.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm surprised you even remember him.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's hard to forget when you wake up with a nametag on your pillow that says, "Hola!  My name is Woody Wiswell."

speaker: Frasier
text: So what's the problem?

speaker: Roz
text: There's just something weird about it.  I don't know, maybe I'm just freaking myself out because I'm not sure I'm ready for this job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course you are, Roz.  I mean, come on, don't doubt yourself.  Listen, they're the ones that called you, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: You go down there and you get that job.  You're going to make a great program director.

speaker: Roz
text: You really think I will?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course I do.  Even though...  I wish you could stay with me forever.  I'm going to miss you so much, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_excited_] Oh, stop it!  I don't even have the job yet, you're gonna jinx it! [_a waiter brings her coffee_] Thank you. [_to Frasier_] Listen, I'd better go and get my presentation together so I can impress Woody Wiswell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Seems to me you've impressed him already.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia--

speaker: Julia
text: [_quickly_] Hello. [_crosses to the counter_] Can I have a latte to go, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Julia, Julia, I've been dying to talk to you all week long about what happened in Avery's office.  Obviously something is going on, and I have several hypotheses. [_Julia gets her coffee and starts adding sugar_] It could be displaced passion, frustration from a failed relationship, or an adrenaline-induced action as a result of stress we were both suffering from...

speaker: Julia
text: [_finishes_] Oh, Frasier, for once in your life, would you please shut up?

speaker: Julia
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin/Niles
text: Oh, hi./Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, you look a little down.  Everything okay? [_to a waiter_] Uh, two coffees, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, if you had any perspicacity whatsoever, you would know that this expression is merely ruminative perplexity.

speaker: Martin
text: My bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's nothing serious.  I'll work it out.

speaker: Niles
text: You know where I like to work things out?  The shooting range.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, Niles, are you still going down there?  I thought you hated guns.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, believe me, I never expected I'd like it as much as I do. But when you're in that booth, focused on-on precision, and accuracy, it's not dissimilar to a kind of meditation. [_Frasier looks intrigued_] Wouldn't you agree, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: [_shrugs_] I just like to shoot stuff, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Fair enough. [_to Frasier_] You should join us.  There's a great bunch of guys I shoot with.  I think you'd like them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not sure I'd fit in with a bunch of trigger-happy gun nuts.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, don't stereotype them.  These are decent family men who enjoy marksmanship.  It's a good group we've got.  Dad and I are going down this afternoon.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't think I'm going to come today, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Well... it's Mitch's birthday.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I usually go shooting twice a year or so, and after this week I've had my fill. [_the waiter brings their coffees_] Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm still going.  My shooting's getting better and better. Oh, plus the gun show's in town and the guys are bringing me passes.

speaker: Frasier
text: A gun show?  What's next, square dancing?

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe. [_raises his cup_] This country was built by gun-totin' square dancers. _Martin clinks his cup against Niles's.  FADE OUT.  FADE IN:  Scene Six -- Woody Wiswell's Office Roz, dressed professionally in a suit, is seated in front of Woody Wiswell, a good-looking man with a permanent friendly smile. _

speaker: Roz
text: So, I really appreciate you bringing me in for this interview. I've been listening to your station for a while, and I've prepared a little presentation that I think will show you what I can bring to the KPXY family.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, that's not necessary.  I mean, this is just a formality. Trust me, I know what you can do.

speaker: Roz
text: [_wary_] Really?

speaker: Woody
text: Yeah.  I, uh, I already told the guys about you.

speaker: Roz
text: What exactly did you tell them?

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, you know -- how incredible you are.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, look, I-I think there's something that needs to be said here.  Why don't we just get it all out in the open?  Yes, we slept together in Cancun, but I don't want that to affect the job.  I mean, it was ten years ago, I...

speaker: Woody
text: What are you talking about?  Look, I think you have me mistaken for someone else.

speaker: Roz
text: And I think I would remember a name like Woody Wiswell.  I mean, seriously, whose named Woody Wiswell?

speaker: Woody
text: Yeah, well, just me and my dad. _His smile disappears as they both realize.  FADE OUT.  FADE IN:  Scene Seven -- Gun Show Daphne looks on uncomfortably as Niles examines a- _

speaker: Daphne
text: Darling, I just don't think you need an ankle holster when you don't even own a gun.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, first of all, who says it's for me, Miss I-Never-Surprise- You-Anymore?  And second of all, I'm thinking I might own a gun soon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_firmly_] No, you won't.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, don't worry.  I, I would keep the gun in a locker at the shooting range.  I would never have a gun in the same house as your mother.

speaker: Martin
text: Now they're saying Daisy Duke might not get here.

speaker: Red
text: Hey, how's it going, kid?

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, you guys, how are you?  Oh, listen, I want you to meet my wife, Daphne.  Daphne, this is Red, and Wayne, and Mitch. These are the guys I was telling you about.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you. [_they ad-lib hellos_]

speaker: Red
text: Listen, kid, we've been talking it over, and since we get along so well at the club, we'd like to invite you down to our compound in Idaho for a weekend.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thrilled_] A compound? [_to Martin and Daphne_] It's just like the Kennedys! [_to the guys_] That sounds smashing.

speaker: Red
text: Hey, that's the spirit.

speaker: Mitch
text: See, I told you.  Hey, look, you're good at math, right? [_Niles shrugs_] Come help me guess how many shells are in that jar so I can win the ATV?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, excuse me. [_as he follows Mitch_] What kind of TV?  [_N.B. All-Terrain Vehicle -- a military transport._]

speaker: Red
text: [_to Daphne_] Nice to meet you, ma'am.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, uh, Red, hold on a second.  Uh, just what kind of place do you guys have in Idaho?

speaker: Red
text: Run-of-the-mill compound in the wilderness -- free country where we live by the true Constitution.

speaker: Daphne
text: They're those militia people!  You fix this, now.

speaker: Niles
text: This is fun, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, son...

speaker: Daphne
text: What your father means is, you shouldn't be friends with these people.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, these are not your kind of guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Why not?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let's just go and we'll talk about it in the car.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't believe you two.  You're always telling me my friends are too artsy and too snooty.  Now I finally have friends who are regular guys, and you don't like them either?  Well, I'm having a good time, and I'm enjoying being a regular guy myself.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, we think they want to overthrow the government!

speaker: Niles
text: That's what you say about public television.  Now, if you'll excuse me?

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, guys, whatcha doing?

speaker: Red
text: We're chipping in for this gas-powered generator.  We're going to need it when it comes time for the New World Order.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that sounds great, excuse me just a second.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, they're militia.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: Go, go, go, go, go.... _They make a hasty exit.  FADE OUT.  FADE IN:  Scene Eight -- Radio Studio Frasier is talking to Roz in her booth.  Roz is still wearing her suit. _

speaker: Frasier
text: I just don't understand how this sort of thing can happen. Don't you look at faces?

speaker: Roz
text: It was a long time ago, it was dark.  And get off my case because it doesn't matter anyway - I got the job!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, congratulations, Roz.  I'm so proud of you.  Now can I tell you how much I'm going to miss you?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: It is going to be sad to leave the station.  But it's not like I'm leaving town, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll see you.

speaker: Frasier
text: See you, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye. _Roz exits down the hallway.  Julia passes by the booth.  Frasier rushes out of the door and calls after her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia!  Julia!  Julia!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. [_crosses into his booth_] Listen, you can try to avoid me all you like.  We are going to talk this thing out.

speaker: Julia
text: Fine, fine.  Anything to get you off my back.

speaker: Julia
text: I was looking at you in the closet, and thinking how you always try to do the right thing, and I felt a rush of affection for you. Call me cynical, but I've come to accept that most people live by the rule of screw or be screwed.  But to see you, and how much you care, and really mean it, I... well, it's endearing. [_holds up a finger_] Irritating, but endearing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I... I am flattered, but there are a lot of genuine people out there.  It's just that for whatever reason -- fear, anger, hurt - they're afraid to show it... _Julia grabs him again and kisses him deeply.  He wraps his arms around her.  Then they break apart._

speaker: Julia
text: [_frustrated_] Oh, it's just like the feeling you get when you see a cute teddy bear in the store and you want to hug it until its head pops off!

speaker: Frasier
text: Could I possibly irritate you over dinner some night?

speaker: Julia
text: [_hesitant, but_] Well, if anybody could, it'd be you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Take your time, work things out.  I'm not going anywhere. I realize that you're in a vulnerable place right now, and that...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I recognize that one.  That was to shut me up.

speaker: Julia
text: Yeah. [_starts to leave, then_] Maybe Thursday. _She exits the booth and walks back down the hallway.  Frasier, smiling, turns and gives a little smitten wave as she passes by the booth.  FADE OUT.  End of Act Two_
